presentations.title: Introduction to Lightning Network
presentations.description: A comprehensive introduction to the Lightning Network, covering the basics of payment channels, routing, and practical applications.
presentations.overview: This presentation provides a deep dive into the Lightning Network, Bitcoin's Layer 2 scaling solution. We'll explore how payment channels work, the routing mechanism that enables instant, low-cost transactions, and real-world use cases. Perfect for developers and enthusiasts who want to understand how Lightning makes Bitcoin more practical for everyday use.

sections.title: What is Lightning Network?
sections.body:
The Lightning Network is a Layer 2 payment protocol that operates on top of Bitcoin. It enables instant, low-cost transactions by creating payment channels between users.

Key benefits:
- Instant transactions
- Low fees
- Scalability
- Privacy improvements

sections.title: How Payment Channels Work
sections.body:
Payment channels allow two parties to transact multiple times off-chain, with only the opening and closing transactions recorded on the Bitcoin blockchain.

This dramatically reduces on-chain transaction volume while maintaining Bitcoin's security guarantees.

sections.title: Routing and Network Effects
sections.body:
The Lightning Network uses a routing protocol that allows payments to be sent through multiple channels, even if the sender and receiver don't have a direct channel.

As more nodes join the network, routing becomes more efficient and reliable.

presentations.title: Taproot and Schnorr Signatures: A Deep Dive
presentations.description: Exploring Taproot and Schnorr signatures, two major Bitcoin protocol upgrades that improve privacy, efficiency, and flexibility.
presentations.overview: Taproot represents one of the most significant upgrades to Bitcoin since SegWit. This presentation covers the technical details of Taproot and Schnorr signatures, explaining how they work, why they matter, and what new possibilities they unlock for Bitcoin applications.

sections.title: Understanding Schnorr Signatures
sections.body:
Schnorr signatures offer several advantages over ECDSA:
- Linear signature aggregation
- Better privacy
- Smaller signature size
- Formal security proofs

sections.title: Taproot Benefits
sections.body:
Taproot improves Bitcoin in multiple ways:
- Enhanced privacy for complex transactions
- Reduced on-chain data
- Lower fees
- More flexible smart contracts

presentations.title: Vibe Coding the Builder Resource Center
presentations.description: How the Builder Ops Team uses structured content, ChatGPT, and Cursor Agents to ship Bitcoin education faster.
presentations.overview: Builder treats vibe coding as an educational engine. This presentation walks through how the team turns loose ideas into structured content blocks, ships them through a Next.js + Vercel pipeline, and keeps iterating with ChatGPT Projects and Cursor Agents—often from a phone. Attendees will see how education-first workflows create real value for the Bitcoin ecosystem while laying the groundwork for future decentralized features.

sections.title: Education as Bitcoin Value
sections.body: The Builder Ops Team frames vibe coding as an education multiplier. Every guide, FAQ, or slide deck removes friction for the next contributor, so the first priority is building a resource center that anyone can remix. By keeping the spotlight on education, Builder turns documentation into a product that compounds value for the ecosystem.

sections.title: Structured Content Everywhere
sections.body: Instead of copy-pasting prose, Builder breaks information into small JSON structures. Those blocks power the website today and can be piped into mobile apps, newsletters, or agent prompts tomorrow. ChatGPT sessions always end by distilling insights straight into schema-friendly snippets so future surfaces can re-use the same source of truth.

sections.title: ChatGPT + Cursor Workflow
sections.body: ChatGPT Pro (with Projects) is the vibe planning space where documents live, questions get answered, and next steps emerge. Cursor Pro keeps build momentum high with AI pair programming, rapid refactors, and the new Agents feature for parallel work—even from a phone. Code flows into GitHub, deploys to Vercel previews, and returns with feedback in minutes.

sections.title: Roadmap to Decentralized Features
sections.body: With the content MVP live, the next moves are clear: ship a backend to edit structured content on the fly, expose the data so other services can subscribe to Builder knowledge, and layer in more Bitcoin-native features like Lightning, Nostr, and decentralization primitives. The same vibe coding habits will power each milestone.
